item.description:
The next meeting of the New England United regional antiwar coalition will be held on Saturday, 27 November,
1-5 pm at Encuentro 5
33 Harrison Ave., fifth floor
(Chinatown stop on the Orange Line T)

The meeting will open with a discussion about the current crisis in Haiti, "Who Killed Haiti and Why?: The US occupation and the fight to rebuild a country free from exploitation". Find a flyer here.

Hear reports from medical personnel just back from relief efforts, and from Ashley Smith, who reported from Haiti during the 1994 occupation. Smith has been active in the Haiti solidarity movement since the 1990s. He has written about Haiti for the International Socialist Review, Znet, and Counterpunch.

This program will be followed by the regular monthly meeting of New England United. Below is a proposed agenda.

1:00 - 2:20 Program: WHO KILLED HAITI AND WHY? (Lisa Savage, facilitator)

General meeting: Marilyn Levin and Shaun Joseph, meeting co-chairs
2:20 - 3:00 Regional Planning for March 20 demonstration in Washington, DC (Chris Garaffa and John Harris, reporters)
3:00 - 3:20 Break/Refreshments
3:20 - 4:00 Evaluation of January 30 NEU conference (Marilyn Levin, reporter)
4:00 - 4:45 Role of 9/11 Truth movement in the antiwar movement (Chris Gauvreau, reporter)
4:45 - 5:00 Announcements, Next Meeting (Mark Stahl, reporter)

For more information call David at 508-653-5534.
item.name: Regional Antiwar Meeting
